theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I need to find the way to a shop that a friend has recommended. I would:

options.a: find out where the shop is in relation to somewhere I know.
options.b: ask my friend to tell me the directions.
options.c: write down the street directions I need to remember.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: A website has a video showing how to make a special graph or chart. There is a person speaking, some lists and words describing what to do and some diagrams. I would learn most from:
I want to find out more about a tour that I am going on. I would:

options.a: look at details about the highlights and activities on the tour.
options.b: use a map and see where the places are.
options.c: read about the tour on the itinerary.
options.d: talk with the person who planned the tour or others who are going on the tour.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: When choosing a career or area of study, these are important for me:

options.a: Applying my knowledge in real situations.
options.c: Working with designs, maps or charts.
options.d: Using words well in written communications.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to save more money and to decide between a range of options. I would:

options.a: consider examples of each option using my financial information.
options.b: read a print brochure that describes the options in detail.
options.c: use graphs showing different options for different time periods.
options.d: talk with an expert about the options.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to learn how to play a new board game or card game. I would:

options.a: watch others play the game before joining in.
options.b: listen to somebody explaining it and ask questions.
options.c: use the diagrams that explain the various stages, moves and strategies in the game.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I have a problem with my heart. I would prefer that the doctor:

options.a: gave me something to read to explain what was wrong.
options.b: used a plastic model to show me what was wrong.
options.d: showed me a diagram of what was wrong.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to learn to do something new on a computer. I would:

options.a: read the written instructions that came with the program.
options.b: talk with people who know about the program.
options.c: start using it and learn by trial and error.
options.d: follow the diagrams in a book.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: When learning from the Internet I like:

options.a: videos showing how to do or make things.
options.c: interesting written descriptions, lists and explanations.
options.d: audio channels where I can listen to podcasts or interviews.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to learn about a new project. I would ask for:

options.a: diagrams to show the project stages with charts of benefits and costs.
options.b: a written report describing the main features of the project.
options.c: an opportunity to discuss the project.
options.d: examples where the project has been used successfully.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to learn how to take better photos. I would:

options.a: ask questions and talk about the camera and its features.
options.b: use the written instructions about what to do.
options.c: use diagrams showing the camera and what each part does.
options.d: use examples of good and poor photos showing how to improve them.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I prefer a presenter or a teacher who uses:

options.b: question and answer, talk, group discussion, or guest speakers.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I have finished a competition or test and I would like some feedback. I would like to have feedback:

options.a: using examples from what I have done.
options.b: using a written description of my results.
options.c: from somebody who talks it through with me.
options.d: using graphs showing what I achieved.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to find out about a house or an apartment. Before visiting it I would want:

options.a: to view a video of the property.
options.c: a printed description of the rooms and features.
options.d: a plan showing the rooms and a map of the area.

theVarkQuestionnaire.question: I want to assemble a wooden table that came in parts (kitset). I would learn best from:

options.a: diagrams showing each stage of the assembly.
options.b: advice from someone who has done it before.
options.c: written instructions that came with the parts for the table.
options.d: watching a video of a person assembling a similar table.
